Breadth-First.Explanation: Initial broad clue collection with no specific hypothesis
Listing man-made object clues in a divergent, descriptive manner
Listing natural elements broadly to gather environmental context
Summarizing key observations across multiple clue types in an exploratory mode

Depth-First.Explanation: Shifts to targeted analysis of distinctive clues
Detailed verification of specific traffic sign clue
Focused analysis of the brick paving pattern
Specific examination of the red utility box design
Focused verification of street layout and planning
Forming a location hypothesis based on accumulated clues
Confirming and reinforcing the German urban environment hypothesis
Further confirmation of a German residential neighborhood
Deepening the hypothesis to an affluent German district
Final hypothesis specifying a Berlin neighborhood

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: The phrase ‘focus on the most distinctive clues’ signals a shift from broad clue gathering to targeted verification
